results.title: Sport mad Woody: The Woody Woodpecker show
results.brief_description: 10 stories featuring characters created by Walter Lantz. “The Contender”: There’s $5,000 prize for beating the defending wrestling champion, The Granulator. Believing TV wrestling is a sham, Woody lays down the challenge in a variety of disguises. “Snow way out”: Knothead and Splinter become victims to shyster ski instructors on the slopes. “Hospital hijinx”: Woody places himself in hospital in an effort to get some TLC. His plan backfires when he’s allocated Head Nurse Meany. “Over the top”: Wally and Woody have a dispute on which sport is better: snowboarding or skiing. They settle the score in a down hill race. “Chilly and the fur-bearing trout”: Chilly Willy attempts to capture himself the elusive fur-bearing trout so that he can get himself a nice, warm, coat. “Painfaker”: Mr Walrus is charged with nursing Woody back to health after he injures him in the park. A camera man accompanies them to ensure the court ruling is adhered to. “Pinheads”: Woody’s experiencing car trouble in the middle of nowhere. He spots a new car but has to beat Buzz Buzzard in 10 Pin Bowling to raise the necessary funds. “The Chilly show”: Chilly becomes the star attraction in a wildlife show. “Silent treatment”: Woody’s neighbour Wally is having a bbq and Woody is determined to get an invite. Wally is determined he can ignore him.

results.title: Sport in Australia
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Cinesound
results.brief_description: A review of sports - tennis, golf, cricket, swimming, athletics. In all these fields Australia has produced a consistent line of champions - Adrian Quist, Kel Nagle, Sir Donald Bradman, Dawn Frazer, John Landy. Sport is an integral part of school education where natural talent combine with sound teaching to produce future champions. Australian Rules Football is the most popular spectator sport.

results.title: Sport for all: a million pounds worth of value
results.creator_credit: Robert Malcolm, Adrian Metcalfe, Sports Council and Martin H Sugarman
results.brief_description: Shows the impact of a thriving multi-use indoor sports centre on a local community. One such centre is Carlton Forum in Nottingham, whereby harnessing additional capital to that received for school facilities, it became possible to build a new social recreational centre to serve the community as a whole. Many of the sports and recreational activities catered for at Carlton Forum are featured with the reactions of people who use its wide range of facilities.

results.title: Sport beams: let's go fishing
results.brief_description: A war time sport related newsreel showcasing some of the more active sides of fishing, particularly deep sea fishing. Commentary remains bright and jolly whilst footage of whales being harpooned pass by the screen.

results.title: Sport and nutrition
results.creator_credit: Tom Trikojus and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: Elite sportspeople are becoming increasingly aware that nutrition is an integral component of their training and competition. This program provides an excellent summary of current nutritional practices for athletes. It looks at the requirements for training, competition and recovery, with a focus on three athletes: Liz Tadich (road cyclist), David Terek (soccer) and Lauren Burns (taekwondo). The program could also be used as a stimulus for further investigation into concepts such as: carbohydrate loading; pre-game meals; ergogenic aids - legal; designing diets for endurance and power athletes and Glycaemic index of foods. The video also examines the validity of the ‘fads, pills and potions’ which seem so common in elite sport today. Video support notes available. Suitable for Lower-Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Sport and coaching
results.creator_credit: Tom Trikojus and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: This program covers the specific coaching skills, different styles and characteristics of a respected coach. Can they understand how to cater for different skill levels from the beginner through to the skilled athlete? The following topics relating to caching are covered: motivation to become a coach; philosophies of coaching; safety - the coaches’ role; planning and goal setting; physiological development of athletes; psychological aspects; management and administration duties; competition day - role of the coach; accreditation requirements for coaching; coaching and its unique challenges; coaches and athletes, the athletes’ view. Support notes available. Suitable for Lower-Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Spoor
results.headline_credit: Czech Republic, Germany, Poland, Slovakia and Sweden, 2017
results.brief_description: A story about Janina Duszejko, an elderly woman, who lives alone in the Klodzko Valley where a series of mysterious crimes are committed. Duszejko is convinced that she knows who (or what) is the murderer, but nobody believes her.

constellations_other.name: Alice Babidge and True History of the Kelly Gang
constellations_other.description: An acclaimed set, costume, and production designer in the world of theatre, Alice Babidge has most recently been working in film including Justin Kurzel features Snowtown and True History Of The Kelly Gang.

results.title: Spook sport
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, Mary-Ellen Bute, Creative Film Society and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An expressionistic interpretation of “Danse macabre” by Camille Saint-Saens. Conventional cel animation and pen drawings were done by Norman McLaren directly on 35 mm film stock.

results.title: Sponges and coelenterates: porous and sac-like animals
results.brief_description: Studies the life cycle of sponges and coelenterates, the simplest multicellular animals. Describes the cell specialisation, sexual and asexual reproduction, and other characteristics of sponges, jellyfish, sea anemones, corals and hydras. Suitable for upper secondary level.
